name: Local Transport
title: LTP
definition: Identifies the switched access local transport elements affected by this request.

validEntry.description: Position (Elements to be ordered by this request)
Lines/Trunks Direct-Trunked Transport and EF to
Lines/Trunks and Direct-Trunked Transport to End
Direct-Trunked Transport and EF to End Office or Hub
Direct-Trunked Transport to End Office or Hub
Direct-Trunked Transport and EF to Access Tandem
Trunks and Direct-Trunked Transport to Access
Trunks Direct-Trunked Transport and EF to Access
Links Direct-Link Transport and EF to STP
Direct-Link Transport and Links to STP
Position (Identifies if element uses special access facility)
Direct-Trunked Transport rides special access facility
Direct-Trunked Transport and EF ride special access
Tandem-Switched Transport rides special access facility
Tandem-Switched Transport and EF ride special access
Voice grade capacity for the EF

validEntryNotes: When ordering local transport to an access tandem the direct-trunked transport valid entries should be used for flat-rated service. Tandem-switched transport valid entries should be used for usage- rated service.
When the first position is “A” the fourth position is prohibited.
When the first position is “C” or “E” and EF is being ordered separately RPON is required.
When the first position is “N” the second third and fourth positions are prohibited.
When the first position is “B” or “C” the use of the fourth position may be prohibited based on provider tariffs/practices.
Use of the third and fourth positions of this field is based on customer practices.
When the first position of the REQTYP field is “L” use of “B” “C” “D” or “E” in the second position is prohibited.
usageNotes: Required when the first position of the REQTYP   field is “M” or “A” and the ACT field is “N” “C” or   “D”.
Required for switched access facilities when the   ACT field is “N” “C” or “D”.
Optional when the first position of the REQTYP   field is “L” and the ACT field is “N” “C” or “D”.
